CKHelper.name: CKHelper
CKHelper.description: Collection of functions used by various plugins of the CKEditor.
CKHelper.author: A.Shcherbakov

Property.name: Property
Property.description: This class defines inline styles of html tags

params.name: obj
params.description: Attributes class variable will be instantiated using this input

Helper.name: Helper
Helper.description: Represents a quantity divided in "value" and "measure".

String.name: String
String.description: Transforms a cell-html string into Cell object. It is supposed that the string to process is of the following form: ... . Inside the tag, there might be other nodes. If they are recognized as a "supported" ones, the corresponding functions will be called to transform them into objects. For the moment, the only supported element is "Table".

CKHelper.name: CKHelper
CKHelper.description: Collection of functions used by various plugins of the CKEditor.

Attributes.name: Attributes
Attributes.description: This class is supposed to define attributes of html tags

params.name: obj
params.description: Attributes class variable will be instantiated using this input

Cell.name: Cell
Cell.description: Represents a table cell. The argument is supposed to be passed to the "content" property.

Content.name: Content
Content.description: This class is used to encompass other objects.

List.name: List
List.description:
This class is used to represent ordered and unordered lists. If argument is provided and is allowed one, it will be used
to set the property "name". Otherwise, "name" property will be set to the first allowed value.

ListItem.name: ListItem
ListItem.description: This class is used to represent a list item.

Property.name: Property
Property.description:
A general Property class. If the argument is an object, then its properties are copied
into Property instance. If the argument is a string, then it will be splitted according to
the pattern "key: value;" to populate object properties. If, in addition, the "value" can be
cast to a number, it will be done.

StringHelper.name: StringHelper
StringHelper.description:
Creates an instance of Tag class and fills in its property "elements" with
the elements recognized inside the string. It is supposed that the string is of the
form <tag [tag-attributes] [style="..."]>....</tag>.

Style.name: Style
Style.description: This class defines inline styles of html tags

params.name: obj
params.description: Style class variable will be instantiated using this input

Tag.name: Tag
Tag.description: This class is used to represent a general html tag.

Unit.name: Unit
Unit.description: Represents a quantity divided in "value" and "measure".

classitems.description: Finds the nearest ascendant of the "elem" for which "filter" returns true
classitems.name: findAscendant

classitems.description: Drops the table row. If after removing the table becomes empty, then removes it as well.
classitems.name: dropRow

params.name: ed
params.description: Represents an editor instance.

classitems.description:
Inserts a row at a specified position with respect to the selected element.
The command to insert the row is obtained by capitalizing the second argument
and appending it to the string 'insert'. Example: if pos is 'after', the command
to be executed is 'insertAfter'.
classitems.name: insertRow

params.name: ed
params.description: Represents an editor instance.

params.name: pos
params.description: where to insert the element with respect to the current one.

classitems.description:
Inserts a column in the table. The localtion of the column to insert is given by the second
argument that admits two values "before" and "after" and is inserted before or after the column
of the selected cell, respectively.
classitems.name: insertColumn

params.name: ed
params.description: Represents an editor instance.

params.name: pos
params.description: "before" or "after": location of the column to insert w.r.t. the current cell

classitems.description:
Generates string representation of this object (as html attributes).
It takse into consideration only strings and numbers. The rest is ignored.
classitems.name: toString

return.description:
a union of substrings; each substring is of this format: 'attribute="value"',
                        between the substrings there is a separator ' ' (space).

classitems.description: Cellpadding attribute of the table. It is supposed that measurement unit is "px".
classitems.name: cellpadding

classitems.description: Cellspacing attribute of the table. It is supposed that measurement unit is "px".
classitems.name: cellspacing

classitems.description: Type of the object. Set to value "Cell" for the objects of this type.
classitems.name: getType

classitems.description: Html tag corresponding to Cell instances.
classitems.name: name

classitems.description: Overrides the inherited methods in order to pass the argument to the constructor of Content class.
classitems.name: content

classitems.description: Styles of the cell
classitems.name: style

classitems.description: Container of items. If an item has a method "toHtml", it will be applied when transforming the whole Content object into a string.
classitems.name: elements

classitems.description: The number of items in the "elements" property
classitems.name: length

classitems.description: Gets the element with index "pos". If it does not exist, null is returned.
classitems.name: getElem

classitems.description: Gets the first element. Delegates to Content::getElem(0)
classitems.name: getFirst

classitems.description: Gets the last element. Delegates to Content::getElem()
classitems.name: getLast

classitems.description: Appends the element to the array Content::elements.

Inserts element at position pos inside the array of elements. If the lenght of array "elements"
is equal to N, than the allowed position index is inside the range [0, 1, ..., N]. If the given
position index is outside that range, an error is thrown. If the position index is equal to N
(that corresponds to appending the element), then Content::appendElem is called.
classitems.name: insertElemAt

classitems.description: Appends element to the array of Content::elements.
classitems.name: appendElem

classitems.description:
Drops the element at the given position and returns it. If element at the position does not exist,
an error is thrown.
classitems.name: dropElemAt

classitems.description: Transforms the object into html form.  If item of the "elements" property is of Object type, then it should have "toHtml" method which is to be applied to the item.
classitems.name: toHtml

classitems.description:
Converts the first letter of the string into the upper case
If the string is empty, the output is empty string as well.
classitems.name: firstLetterUpperCase

classitems.description:
Converts the first letter of the string into the upper case
If the string is empty, the output is empty string as well.
classitems.name: onlyFirstLetterUpperCase

classitems.description:
transforms each element of the input array into a non-negative number.
If an element is negative, its absolute value is used.
If an element fails to be converted to a number, it is substituted by zero.
classitems.name: sanitize

params.name: arr
params.description: array of numbers

classitems.description: calculates the sum the array elements. The elements are supposed to be numbers. Otherwise nothing is guaranteed.
classitems.name: trace

params.name: arr
params.description: array of numbers

classitems.description:
normalizes the array. If all elements are equal to zero, then the elements are to be normallized uniformally.
If not all the elements are equal to zero, but the trace is equal to zero, then the input array is returned.
classitems.name: normalize

params.name: Array
params.description: of numbers

classitems.description:
Slices the first argument according to the weights given by the second argument.
The elements of the second array are supposed to be non-negative numbers.
classitems.name: splitWeighted

params.name: overall
params.description: a number to be splitted

params.name: pieces
params.description: array of weigths

classitems.description: rounds each elements of the array
classitems.name: roundUp

params.name: arr
params.description: array of numbers

classitems.description: composition of roundUp and splitWeighted
classitems.name: columnWidths

params.name: overall
params.description: table width

params.name: pieces
params.description: array of nambers

classitems.description:
Deletes the protocol name from the url.
Everything until the first occurence of '://' will be removed (inclusively).
classitems.name: dropProtocol

classitems.description: Gives file extension.
classitems.name: fileExt

classitems.description:
Gives the validated width. If the width is given in "px" or "pt", the integer part is given.
If the length is given in "em" or "%", it is left as it is.
classitems.name: validateWidth

classitems.description:
Replaces special characters present in the input string by their unicodes. It is supposed to replace symbols like à, ò, è, é
and not a, b, c etc. For the moment it replaces any characters which unicode is outside the range [32, 125].
classitems.name: specialChar

classitems.description:
Splits array element at position "pos" in two parts in such a way that the trace of the original array
is equal to the trace of the output array. If it is the first element of the array to be splitted, then
it is splitted in 1/2 and 1/2 (up to the truncation). If the element has a left neighbour, then the neighbour
and the element are taken off 1/3 and these two parts are given to the newly created element that is inserted
between the neighbour and the element: [a, b, ...] -> [2/3 a, 1/3 (a + b), 2/3 b, ...]
classitems.name: crack

params.name: arr
params.description: array of integers

params.name: pos
params.description: index of the element, before which an element will be inserted

classitems.description: Flatten the object. This function was written because Node::attributes returns attributes in format.
classitems.name: flatten

classitems.description:
Sandwiches the midlle string with the left and the right ones. If the middle one is empty, empty string is returned.
If the right arguments is not given, the left one is used.
classitems.name: sandwichWith

classitems.description: Glues all elements of the array, replace trailing spaces and repaces multiple spaces with a single one.
classitems.name: concatDropSpaces

params.name: glue
params.description: glue string

classitems.description:
Generates a string that can be used as id for the elements of the target string. This means that
the generated string must be not present among id's of the elements of the target string. The argument
serves as a hint to create the id: if the hint string is available as id, it will be returned. Otherwise,
a random symbol from 0-9, a-z will be appended to the hint string until it becomes a valid id.
classitems.name: generateId

classitems.description: Array of allowed values for the tag names: ['ol', 'ul'].
classitems.name: allowedNames

classitems.description: Styles corresponding to the list as a whole object.
classitems.name: style

classitems.description:
Html tag corresponding to List object. It is taken from the name provided
when creating the object: list = new List('ul'). If not provided or  if it
is provided, but it is not allowed, then the first allowed value is used.
classitems.name: name

classitems.description: Gets the number of the list items
classitems.name: itemNum

classitems.description:
Appends an object to the list items. The object must be a ListItem instance.
If not, an error is thrown.
classitems.name: appendItem

params.name: item
params.description: an instance of ListItem

classitems.description:
Inserts the item at the given position. If the item to insert is a ListItem instance, then
Content::insertElemAt() is called. Otherwise, an error is thrown.
classitems.name: isertItemAt

params.name: pos
params.description: index of the position of there to insert the item

params.name: item
params.description: item to insert

classitems.description: List item html tag.
classitems.name: name

classitems.description: List item styles
classitems.name: style

classitems.description: Appends the element to the content of the list item.
classitems.name: appendElem

classitems.description:
Fill in the properties with the values from the argument if any.
Splits the argument according to tha pattern "key: value;"

Gets the number of properties of the object (all properties to which the object
responds and that are not of function type).
classitems.name: propNum

classitems.description:
Compares properties of the target and with the proprties of the argument.
Returns true, if they are pair-wise the same (key of the target is present among argument keys, and the values are equal).
Otherwise, false is returned. When making comparison, all methods are ignored.
classitems.name: isTheSameAs

classitems.description:
Appends property. Converts the argument to a Property and appends it to the target one.
Properties with the same name will be overridden.
classitems.name: appendProperty

params.name: prop
params.description: it will be converted into a Property object and then appended to the target object.

classitems.description: Type of the object. Return "Row" for the objects of this type.
classitems.name: getType

classitems.description: Html tag corresponding to Row instances.
classitems.name: name

classitems.description: Styles of the row.
classitems.name: style

classitems.description: Gets an array of the widths of the cells inside the row.
classitems.name: getCellWidths

classitems.description: Alias for length() method of the parent class.
classitems.name: cellNum

classitems.description: Sets widths of the cells inside the row.
classitems.name: setCellWidths

params.name: profile
params.description: each elements if this array is a width of the corresp. cell in the row.

classitems.description:
Inserts a cell into a given position. If the object to insert is a Cell instance,
then parent method insertElemAt is called. Otherwise, an error is thrown.
classitems.name: insertCellAt

params.name: cell
params.description: a cell to insert. If not a Cell instance, an error will be thrown.

params.name: pos
params.description: position at which the cell is to be inserted.

classitems.description:
Appends a cell to the row cells. If one tries to append a non-Cell object, an exception is thrown.
Otherwise, a method appendElem of the parent class is called.
classitems.name: appendCell

params.name: cell
params.description: a cell to be appended. If not a Cell instance, an error is thrown.

classitems.description:
Returns true if the row contains only one cell and this cell contains only one element
that is a Table() instance. Otherwise, false is returned.
classitems.name: onlyTableInside

classitems.description: Alias for dropElemAt().
classitems.name: dropCellAt

params.name: pos
params.description: index of the cell to de dropped out.

classitems.description:
12/02/2014 11:55: dropCell --> knockOutCell
Drops the cell at the given position and resizes the remaining cells. If the cell is utmost left, the freed space is then
assigned to its right neighbour:
|xxx| a | b   | c | -> |     a | b   | c |
| a |xxx| b   | c | -> | a |     b   | c |
If there is no right neighbour, then it is assigned to the left one:
| a | b | c | xxx | -> | a | b | c       |
If the cell to delete does not exist, nothing is performed.
classitems.name: knockOutCell

params.name: cellNum
params.description: cell number to delete. Numeration starts with 0.

classitems.description: Appends style to a given cell of the row. Alias for Tag::appendStyleToElemAt().
classitems.name: appendStyleToCellAt

params.name: cellNum
params.description: index of the target cell

params.name: stl
params.description: style to be appended

classitems.description:
Populates the attributes from a string that is an html repersentation of some row.
It takes a string that is an html representation of a row and update current object
parameters such that it will correspond to the html representation.
In other words, (new Row()).loadFromHtml(htmlString).toHtml() should be similar to htmlString
(eventually up to presence/absence of some parameters and attributes).
classitems.name: loadFromHtml

classitems.description:
If the row corresponds to a framed row (a row for which method
__Row::onlyTableInside()__ returns true), then style of the cell is returned,
null otherwise. This is an alias for __Row::getBogusCellProp('style')__.
classitems.name: getBogusCellStyle

classitems.description:
If the row corresponds to a framed row (a row for which method
__Row::onlyTableInside()__ returns true), then cell attributes object is returned,
null otherwise. This is an alias for __Row::getBogusCellProp('attr')__.
classitems.name: getBogusCellAttr

classitems.description:
If the row corresponds to a framed row (a row for which method
__Row::onlyTableInside()__ returns true), then requested property the cell inside the row is returned,
null otherwise.
classitems.name: getBogusCellProp

params.name: prop
params.description: name of the property to return (intended values: "style" or "attr")

classitems.description:
If the row corresponds to a framed row (a row for which method __Row::onlyTableInside()__
returns true), then requested property name of the table inside the cell inside the row is returned,
null otherwise.
classitems.name: getBogusTableProp

params.name: prop
params.description: name of the property to return (intended values: "style" or "attr")

classitems.description:
If the row corresponds to a framed row (a row for which method __Row::onlyTableInside()__
returns true), then style of the table inside the cell is returned, null otherwise.
This is an alias for __Row::getBogusTableProp('style')__.
classitems.name: getBogusTableStyle

classitems.description:
If the row corresponds to a framed row (a row for which method __Row::onlyTableInside()__
returns true), then attribute of the table inside the cell is returned, null otherwise.
This is an alias for __Row::getBogusTableProp('attr')__.
classitems.name: getBogusTableAttr

classitems.description:
Generates string representation of this object (as html inline style).
It takse into consideration only string- and number-valued properties. The rest is ignored.
If attribite value is a number, the measurement unit will be appended.
classitems.name: toString

params.name: unit
params.description: mesurement unit to be added to the numerical attribute values. By default, it is set to 'px'.

return.description:
String   union of substrings; each substring is of this format: 'attribute: value;',
                                  between the substrings there is a separator ' '.

classitems.description: Appends style. Alias for the parent method Property::appendProperty()
classitems.name: appendStyle

params.name: stl
params.description: it will be passed to the parent method

classitems.description: Imposes the width, min-width and max-width.
classitems.name: setWidth

params.name: w
params.description: value of width.

classitems.description:
Returns object {width: ..., color: ..., style: ...} describing border. If the Style has no property
'border-style', then 'none' will be used. If the Style has no 'border-width', then zero will be used.
If the Style has no property 'border-color', then it will not be set.
classitems.name: getBorderInfo

classitems.description: Color of the border table

classitems.description: Table minimal width. It is supposed to be equal to "width" property.

classitems.name: border-color

classitems.description: Style of the border table. See html manuals for possible values.
classitems.name: border-style

classitems.name: vertical-align

classitems.description: Font color

classitems.default: "#000001". NB: Gmail removes color tags corresponding to the black color, so use #000001 instead of #000000.

classitems.description: Font size of the  text in the list.
classitems.name: font-size

classitems.description: Text color of the list item content.
classitems.name: color
classitems.default: "#000001". NB: Gmail removes color tags corresponding to the black color, so use #000001 instead of #000000.

classitems.description: Font weight. Some possible values: "normal", "bold", "bolder", 100, 200, ..., 900. See html manuals for more info.
classitems.name: font-weight

classitems.description: Padding.
classitems.name: padding

classitems.description: Margin.
classitems.name: margin

classitems.description: Type of the object. Returns "Table" for the objects of this type.
classitems.name: getType

classitems.description: Html tag corresponding to Table instances.
classitems.name: name

classitems.description: Attributes of the table. Overrides parent property "attr".
classitems.name: attr

classitems.description: Styles of the row. Overrides parent property "style".
classitems.name: style

classitems.description: The number of the rows in the table. Alias of length() of the parent class.
classitems.name: rowNum

classitems.description: Appends a row to the content property. If the argument is not a Row instance, an error is thrown.
classitems.name: appendRow

params.name: row
params.description: a row to append. If not a Row instance, an error is thrown.

classitems.description:
Gives a two-dimensional array [[w_11, w_12, ..., w_1n], ..., [w_m1, w_m2, ..., w_m3]]
where w_ij is width of the cell located in the row i and column j.
classitems.name: getMatrix

classitems.description:
Returns array of widths of the cells in the table rows if all rows
have the same cell widths. Otherwise null is returned.
classitems.name: getProfile

classitems.description:
Imposes the widths of all cell in all rows of the table. If the argument is not array, an error is thrown.
If the array length is different from the number of columns, an error is thrown. Otherwise, it is called
method of Row::setCellWidths on each table row.
classitems.name: setProfile

params.name: profile
params.description: an array of cell widths that will be applied to each row.

classitems.description:
Inserts a cell "cell" into a given position "pos" of each row of the table.
If the table has 5 columns, then after insertion it will have 5+1=6 columns.
Position "pos" will correspond to the index of the inserted cell in the row after insertion.
"pos" must be a valid cell number into the table after insertion. So, for the example above,
the valid values for "pos" are 0, 1, 2, 3, 4 and 5.
classitems.name: insertColAt

classitems.description: Knocks out given column from the table. The operation is delegated to the `Row::knockOutCell()`
classitems.name: knockOutCol

params.name: colNum
params.description: the number of the column to be knocked out. Numeration starts with 0.

classitems.description: Drops specified column from the table. The operation is delegated to the `Row::dropCellAt()`
classitems.name: dropColAt

params.name: colNum
params.description: the number of the column to delete. Numeration starts with 0.

classitems.description:
Gives the number of columns in the table or null if not all rows have the same number of cells.
The operation is delegated to the `Row::cellNum()`.
classitems.name: colNum

classitems.description: Whether all rows in the table have the same cell widths.
classitems.name: isSameWidth

return.description: true, if all rows have the same cells' widths, false otherwise.

classitems.description:
Set the border of the table. It updates the properties 'attr' and 'style' of the instance:
1. in 'style' property, sets up the following properties: 'border-width', 'border-color' and 'border-style'
2. in 'attr' property, sets up 'border' property.
Note that if after setting the border there is an assigment of 'style' or 'attr' property, then some info about the border might be overwritten.
classitems.name: setBorder

params.name: borderInfo
params.description: Object containing 'width', 'color' and 'style' for the border to set.

classitems.default: border-width is set to 1, border-color is set to #000000, border-style is set to solid.

classitems.description:
Removes the border of the table. It updates the properties 'attr' and 'style' of the instance:
1. in 'style' property, deletes the properties: 'border-width', 'border-color' and sets up 'border-style' to 'none'
2. in 'attr' property, deletes 'border' property.
classitems.name: removeBorder

classitems.description:
Returns true if the table is framed, and false otherwise. It takes table rows and call method `Row::onlyTableInside()` on each of them until first "false" is encountered.
A table is a __framed table__ if all table rows have only one cell and this cell contains only one element that is a Table instance.
classitems.name: isFragmented

return.description: true if the table is framed, and false otherwise

classitems.description:
Gives true if all table rows have border around (that is, each row is nothing but a table with border)
false otherwise. It at least one of the properties, corresponding to the "bogus" elements is set, then
the table is considered as being framed and hence all its rows will be framed.
classitems.name: isFramed

return.description: true, if all table rows have border around

classitems.description: Resets bogus properties. After resetting those properties, the table becomes a table without frame.
classitems.name: resetBogus

classitems.description:
Appends the style to the column. If the column exists, the method call `Row::appendStyleToCell()`
on each of the table rows.
classitems.name: appendStyleToCol

params.name: colNum
params.description: column number to which the style is to be appended.

params.name: style
params.description: Style or Object to be appended

classitems.description:
Generates table-specific html code with corresponding attributes and styles.
Creation of the row-related html of each row is delegated to `Row::toHtml()`
classitems.name: toHtml

classitems.description:
Style of the row containing a single cell. It is used to created to a table with framed lines.
It is supposed that all properties
bogusRowStyle, bogusRowAttr, bogusCellStyle, bogusCellAttr, bogusTableStyle, bogusTableAttr
are simultaneously null or set.
classitems.name: bogusRowStyle

classitems.description:
Attributes of the row containing a single cell. It is used to created to a table with framed lines.
It is supposed that all properties
bogusRowStyle, bogusRowAttr, bogusCellStyle, bogusCellAttr, bogusTableStyle, bogusTableAttr
are simultaneously null or set.
classitems.name: bogusRowAttr

classitems.description:
Style of the  the cell which fills the whole row. It is used to created to a table with framed lines.
It is supposed that all properties
bogusRowStyle, bogusRowAttr, bogusCellStyle, bogusCellAttr, bogusTableStyle, bogusTableAttr
are simultaneously null or set.
classitems.name: bogusCellStyle

classitems.description:
Attributes of the  the cell which fills the whole row. It is used to created to a table with framed lines.
It is supposed that all properties
bogusRowStyle, bogusRowAttr, bogusCellStyle, bogusCellAttr, bogusTableStyle, bogusTableAttr
are simultaneously null or set.
classitems.name: bogusCellAttr

classitems.description:
Style of the  the table that will be inserted into the single cell to create a table with framed lines.
It is supposed that all properties
bogusRowStyle, bogusRowAttr, bogusCellStyle, bogusCellAttr, bogusTableStyle, bogusTableAttr
are simultaneously null or set.
classitems.name: bogusTableStyle

classitems.description:
Attributes of the  the table that will be inserted into the single cell to create a table with framed lines.
It is supposed that all properties
bogusRowStyle, bogusRowAttr, bogusCellStyle, bogusCellAttr, bogusTableStyle, bogusTableAttr
are simultaneously null or set.
classitems.name: bogusTableAttr

classitems.description:
If the table is fragmented and all rows have the same requested property, then
this property of the first row is returned. In any other case, null is returned.
NB: to compare requested property for all rows, this property must be an object
with boolean-valued method isTheSameAs().
classitems.name: getBogusRowProp

params.name: prop
params.description: a name of the property to return. All rows shiuld have this property.

return.description:
the value of the property specified by the argument, if it is the same
                                     for all rows, null otherwise.

classitems.description:
If the table is fragmented and all the rows have the same styles, then this style is returned.
Otherwise, null is returned. This is an alias for `Table::getBogusRowProp('style')`.
classitems.name: getBogusRowStyle

classitems.description:
If the table is fragmented and all the rows have the same styles, then this style is returned.
Otherwise, null is returned. This is an alias for `Table::getBogusRowProp('attr')`.
classitems.name: getBogusRowAttr

classitems.description:
If the table is fragmented, gives the requested property of the bogus cell if that property is
the same for all rows. Otherwise, null is returned.
classitems.name: getBogusCellProp

params.name: propName
params.description: requested property (supposed to be "style" or "attr")

classitems.description:
If the table is fragmented, returns the style of the bogus cell if it is the same for all cells.
Otherwise, null is returned. This is an alias for `Table::getBogusCellProp('style')`.
classitems.name: getBogusCellStyle

classitems.description:
If the table is fragmented, returns the attributes of the bogus cell if it is the same for all cells.
Otherwise, null is returned. This is an alias for `Table::getBogusCellProp('attr')`.
classitems.name: getBogusCellAttr

classitems.description:
If the table is fragmented, gives the requested property of the bogus cell if that property is
the same for all rows. Otherwise, null is returned.
classitems.name: getBogusTableProp

params.name: propName
params.description: requested property (supposed to be "style" or "attr")

classitems.description:
If the table is fragmented, returns the style of the bogus table if it is the same for all tables.
Otherwise, null is returned. This is an alias for `Table::getBogusTableProp('style')`.
classitems.name: getBogusTableStyle

classitems.description:
If the table is fragmented, returns the attributes of the bogus table if it is the same for all tables.
Otherwise, null is returned. This is an alias for `Table::getBogusTableProp('attr')`.
classitems.name: getBogusTableAttr

classitems.description:
If the table is fragmented, then sets up the bogus properties and rearrange content property.
If not, the table remains as it is.
classitems.name: desintangle

classitems.description: Tag name.To be set explicitely in child classes.
classitems.name: name

classitems.description: Returns value of the name attribute.
classitems.name: getName

classitems.description: Tag attributes
classitems.name: attr

classitems.description: Attribute setter.
classitems.name: setAttr

classitems.description: Appends style to the cell. Alias for Style::appendStyle().
classitems.name: appendStyle

params.name: stl
params.description: style to be appended

classitems.description:
Appends style to the element at position pos. It is supposed that such an element exists
and it has a property "style" which is a Style instance. In this case method
Style::appendStyle() will be called on this element.
Otherwise, an error is thrown.
classitems.name: appendStyleToElemAt

classitems.description: Tag styles
classitems.name: style

classitems.description: Style setter.
classitems.name: setStyle

classitems.description: Retrieves requested property from the "style" property of the current object.
classitems.name: getStyleProp

params.name: prop
params.description: property name which value should be retrieved

classitems.description:
Imposes the value of the width of the "attr" and "style" properties. In the latter, "min-width"
and "max-width" are imposed as well. It is better to use with an integer argument and without
unit of measurement (as attr property should not have unit of measurement in its string representation
when convirting it in html form).
classitems.name: setWidth

classitems.description:
Gets the width of the object as it is present in the style property. It tends to return a number:
if it is measured in "px", then the measurment unit is removed and the number is returned.
classitems.name: getWidth

classitems.description: Content of the tag.
classitems.name: content

classitems.description: Gets the element stored in property "content". Delegates its functionality to the class Content.
classitems.name: getElem

classitems.description: Gets the first element stored in property "content". Delegates its functionality to the class Content.
classitems.name: getFirst

classitems.description: Gets the last element stored in property "content". Delegates its functionality to the class Content.
classitems.name: getLast

classitems.description: Inserts an element into given position. Delegates its functionality to the class Content.
classitems.name: insertElemAt

classitems.description: Appends the element to the content of the list item. Delegates to Content::appendElem().
classitems.name: appendElem

classitems.description: Returns the number of elements inside its content. Delegates to Content::length().
classitems.name: length

classitems.description: Deletes element from "content" property. Delegates its functionalality to Content::dropElemAt().
classitems.name: dropElemAt

classitems.description: Gives html representation of the instance. If tag name is undefined or empty, just html comment is generated.
classitems.name: toHtml

return.description: html representation of an instance of this class.

classitems.description:
Compares the target with the argument. Returns true, if the argument can be cast to the target type
with the same "measurement" property. False otherwise.
classitems.name: isLikeAs

classitems.description: Sums up the target and the argument. If they have different units of measurement, an error is thrown.
classitems.name: add

return.description: the sum of the target and the argument.

classitems.description:
Subtracts the argument from the target. The argument is converted to a Unit object,
then its sign is changed and the method Unit::add() is called.
classitems.name: sub

params.name: obj
params.description: it will be first converted to a Unit instance.

return.description: the difference between target and the argument.

classitems.description: Create key-value caches of limited size

return.description:
Returns the Object data after storing it on itself with
	property name the (space-suffixed) string and (if the cache is larger than Expr.cacheLength)
	deleting the oldest entry

classitems.description: Mark a function for special use by Sizzle

params.name: fn
params.description: The function to mark

classitems.description: Support testing using an element

params.name: fn
params.description: Passed the created div and expects a boolean result

classitems.description: Adds the same handler for all of the specified attrs

params.name: attrs
params.description: Pipe-separated list of attributes

params.name: handler
params.description: The method that will be applied

classitems.description: Checks document order of two siblings

return.description: Returns less than 0 if a precedes b, greater than 0 if a follows b

Returns a function to use in pseudos for positionals

It is based on CKEDITOR.editor.insertElement() method.
This approach might be wrong but I wanted to avoid repetitions.
